senses.de: To use or do something for a particular purpose
senses.ex: You need to apply more effort to achieve this task.

Tips.title: Action Required
Tips.description: When using 'apply', it usually means taking action to achieve something.
Tips.example: To improve, you must apply the feedback from your teacher.

Tips.title: Active Context
Tips.description: Use 'apply' when something actively connects to a task or goal.
Tips.example: Apply your learning to solve real-world problems.

senses.de: To make a formal request or apply for something, like a job or admission to an institution
senses.ex: She decided to apply for the job she saw online.

Tips.title: Formal Requests
Tips.description: 'Apply for' signals a formal process and is often bureaucratic.
Tips.example: I need to apply for a new passport before my trip.

Tips.title: Initiative
Tips.description: 'Apply for' implies personal initiative to obtain something.
Tips.example: He will apply for scholarships for his college education.

senses.de: To put or spread something onto something else
senses.ex: Please apply the ointment to the affected area twice a day.

Tips.title: Direct Action
Tips.description: 'Apply' often involves a direct physical action of placing one thing on another.
Tips.example: Apply glue evenly over the surface before sticking the paper.

Tips.title: Medical Treatments
Tips.description: In medical context, 'apply' suggests following treatment instructions.
Tips.example: Apply the bandage firmly but not too tightly.

senses.de: To be relevant or applicable to a particular situation or person
senses.ex: These rules apply to everyone, without exception.

Tips.title: Universal Rules
Tips.description: Used to state that a rule or condition affects everyone or everything in that situation.
Tips.example: This discount doesn't apply to items on sale.

Tips.title: Relevance
Tips.description: When 'apply' is used, it means something is relevant or pertains.
Tips.example: Does this law apply to online businesses too?

senses.de: To use a rule, law, or piece of knowledge
senses.ex: The judge must apply the law fairly.

Tips.title: Legal Context
Tips.description: In legal terms, 'apply' means to carry out or use laws/rules.
Tips.example: Police officers must apply the laws impartially.

Tips.title: Academic Usage
Tips.description: In academia, 'apply' indicates utilizing theories or knowledge practically.
Tips.example: Apply the mathematical formulas to solve this equation.

Administer.wordDefinition:
Administer means to give or manage something, especially something official, like a medicine or a test. For example: the doctor administered a vaccine to the patient.

Administer is typically used in situations where someone is giving something to another person or managing something, while apply is used when someone is using something in a specific way.

Carry out.wordDefinition:
Carry out means to complete or perform a task or action.

It is used when you are doing something that you have planned or been instructed to do. For example, carrying out an experiment means you are executing the steps necessary to complete that experiment.

Apply is used when you are putting something into action or use, whereas carry out is used when you are completing or performing a task or action.

Employ.wordDefinition:
Employ means to hire someone for a job or a position. For example, "The company employs over 500 people."

To apply means to ask for a job, and to employ means to give someone a job. Apply is used when you are talking about the person who wants the job, and employ is used when you are talking about the company or person doing the hiring.

Execute.wordDefinition:
Execute means to carry out or complete a task or instruction with precision and accuracy. For example, if you execute a plan, you are following it carefully to make sure everything is done correctly.

You might also execute a command on a computer to make it perform a specific task.

Apply is used more for initiating something, while execute is used more for completing it accurately.

Implement.wordDefinition:
Implement means to put a plan into action or to carry out something that has been decided upon. For example, when a company implements a new policy, they put that policy into action and make sure everyone follows it.

Apply is used when you are using something for a specific purpose, while implement is used when you are putting a plan or decision into action.

Practice.wordDefinition:
Practice means to repeatedly do something to improve your skills. For example, if you want to learn a musical instrument, you need to practice regularly to improve your skills.

In essence, apply is used when you use a skill or knowledge that you have already acquired, while practice is used to develop and improve that skill or knowledge.

Use.wordDefinition:
Apply usually means to use something for a particular purpose or to make a request for something. For example, you would apply for a job, apply makeup to your face, or apply fertilizer to plants.

Use refers to employing something to achieve a particular goal or function. For example, you would use a hammer to drive a nail or use a pen to write.

While both words can mean to utilize something, apply is more specific and often implies a more intentional or purposeful use, whereas use is a more general term that can encompass any kind of employment of an object or tool.

Utilize.wordDefinition:
Utilize means to use something for a specific purpose, often in a more intentional or strategic way. You use this word in situations where you want to emphasize the importance or effectiveness of your use of something.

For example, you might utilize a new technology to improve your business operations. You might utilize your time by prioritizing your tasks and working efficiently.

You might utilize a particular skill or talent to achieve your goals.

However, apply is more general and can be used in a wide range of situations, while utilize suggests a more intentional and strategic use of something.
